sn51.3:1.1.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā ariyā niyyānikā niyyanti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāya.
sn51.3:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when these four bases of psychic power are developed and cultivated they are noble and emancipating, and bring one who practices them to the complete ending of suffering.

sn51.3:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.3:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.3:1.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā ariyā niyyānikā niyyanti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.
sn51.3:1.7.eng: When these four bases of psychic power are developed and cultivated they are noble and emancipating, and bring one who practices them to the complete ending of suffering.”

sn51.30:1.1.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu …pe…
sn51.30:1.1.eng: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha …

sn51.30:1.2.pli: ekamantaṃ nisinne kho te bhikkhū bhagavā etadavoca:

sn51.30:1.3.pli: “katamā nu kho, bhikkhave, iddhi, katamo iddhipādo, katamā iddhipādabhāvanā, katamā iddhipādabhāvanāgāminī paṭipadā”ti?
sn51.30:1.3.eng: “Mendicants, what is psychic power? What is the basis of psychic power? What is the development of the bases of psychic power? And what is the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power?”

sn51.30:1.4.eng: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. He is our guide and our refuge. …”

sn51.30:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vatteti—
sn51.30:2.2.eng: It’s a mendicant who wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again … controlling the body as far as the realm of divinity.

sn51.30:3.1.eng: And what is the basis of psychic power?

sn51.30:3.2.pli: Yo, bhikkhave, maggo, yā paṭipadā iddhilābhāya iddhipaṭilābhāya saṃvattati—
sn51.30:3.2.eng: The path and practice that leads to gaining psychic power.

sn51.30:3.3.eng: This is called the basis of psychic power.

sn51.30:4.1.eng: And what is the development of the bases of psychic power?

sn51.30:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.30:4.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.30:4.6.eng: This is called the development of the bases of psychic power.

sn51.30:5.1.eng: And what is the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power?

sn51.30:5.2.eng: It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

sn51.30:5.3.eng: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

sn51.30:5.4.eng: This is called the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power.”

sn51.31:1.1.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

sn51.31:1.3.pli: katamesaṃ dhammānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo”ti?
sn51.31:1.3.eng: What things has the mendicant Moggallāna developed and cultivated so as to have such power and might?”

sn51.31:2.1.eng: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. He is our guide and our refuge. …”

sn51.31:2.2.pli: “catunnaṃ kho, bhikkhave, iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo.
sn51.31:2.2.eng: “The mendicant Moggallāna has become so powerful and mighty by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

sn51.31:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, moggallāno bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti—
sn51.31:3.2.eng: Moggallāna develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.

sn51.31:3.3.pli: iti me chando na ca atilīno bhavissati, na ca atippaggahito bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṃ saṅkhitto bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhitto bhavissati.
sn51.31:3.3.eng: He thinks: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’

sn51.31:3.4.eng: And he meditates perceiving before and behind:

sn51.31:3.5.pli: yathā pure tathā pacchā, yathā pacchā tathā pure;
sn51.31:3.5.eng: as before, so behind; as behind, so before;

sn51.31:3.6.pli: yathā adho tathā uddhaṃ, yathā uddhaṃ tathā adho;
sn51.31:3.6.eng: as below, so above; as above, so below;

sn51.31:3.7.pli: yathā divā tathā rattiṃ, yathā rattiṃ tathā divā.
sn51.31:3.7.eng: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.

sn51.31:3.8.pli: Iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
sn51.31:3.8.eng: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, he develops a mind that’s full of radiance.

sn51.31:3.9.eng: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy …

sn51.31:3.12.pli: iti me vīmaṃsā na ca atilīnā bhavissati, na ca atippaggahitā bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṃ saṅkhittā bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhittā bhavissati …pe…
sn51.31:3.12.eng: He thinks: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’ …

sn51.31:3.13.pli: iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
sn51.31:3.13.eng: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, he develops a mind that’s full of radiance.

sn51.31:3.14.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo.
sn51.31:3.14.eng: The mendicant Moggallāna has become so powerful and mighty by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.

sn51.31:4.1.pli: Imesañca pana, bhikkhave, catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu evaṃ anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti, bahudhāpi hutvā eko hoti …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vatteti.
sn51.31:4.1.eng: And by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, the mendicant Moggallāna wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying himself and becoming one again … controlling the body as far as the realm of divinity.

sn51.31:4.2.pli: Imesañca pana, bhikkhave, catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharatī”ti.
sn51.31:4.2.eng: And by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, the mendicant Moggallāna realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And he lives having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.”

sn51.33-44:1.1.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gaṅgā nadī pācīnaninnā pācīnapoṇā pācīnapabbhārā;
sn51.33-44:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.

sn51.33-44:1.2.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cattāro iddhipāde bhāvento cattāro iddhipāde bahulīkaronto nibbānaninno hoti nibbānapoṇo nibbānapabbhāro.
sn51.33-44:1.2.eng: In the same way, a mendicant who develops and cultivates the four bases of psychic power slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.

sn51.33-44:1.3.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cattāro iddhipāde bhāvento cattāro iddhipāde bahulīkaronto nibbānaninno hoti nibbānapoṇo nibbānapabbhāro?
sn51.33-44:1.3.eng: And how does a mendicant who develops the four bases of psychic power slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment?

sn51.33-44:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.33-44:1.4.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.33-44:2.1.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cattāro iddhipāde bhāvento cattāro iddhipāde bahulīkaronto nibbānaninno hoti nibbānapoṇo nibbānapabbhāro”ti.
sn51.33-44:2.1.eng: That’s how a mendicant who develops and cultivates the four bases of psychic power slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”

sn51.5:1.1.pli: “Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā iddhipadesaṃ abhinipphādesuṃ sabbe te catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn51.5:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past who have partly manifested psychic powers have done so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

sn51.5:1.2.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā iddhipadesaṃ abhinipphādessanti sabbe te catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn51.5:1.2.eng: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will partly manifest psychic powers will do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

sn51.5:1.3.eng: All the ascetics and brahmins in the present who are partly manifesting psychic powers do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

sn51.5:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,

sn51.7:1.3.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi bhikkhū āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharanti, sabbe te catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn51.7:1.3.eng: present who realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and who live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

sn51.7:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.7:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.7:2.6.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ bhikkhū āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihariṃsu sabbe te imesaṃyeva catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn51.7:2.6.eng: All the mendicants in the past …

sn51.7:2.7.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ bhikkhū āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissanti, sabbe te imesaṃyeva catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.

sn51.7:2.8.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi bhikkhū āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharanti, sabbe te imesaṃyeva catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā”ti.
sn51.7:2.8.eng: present who realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and who live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.”

sn51.77-86:1.3.eng: Desire for rebirth in the realm of luminous form, desire for rebirth in the formless realm, conceit, restlessness, and ignorance.

sn51.77-86:1.4.eng: These are the five higher fetters.

sn51.77-86:1.5.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ uddhambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ abhiññāya pariññāya parikkhayāya pahānāya cattāro iddhipādā bhāvetabbā.
sn51.77-86:1.5.eng: The four bases of psychic power should be developed for the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these five higher fetters.

sn51.77-86:1.7.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.77-86:1.7.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.77-86:1.11.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ uddhambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ abhiññāya pariññāya parikkhayāya pahānāya ime cattāro iddhipādā bhāvetabbā”ti.
sn51.77-86:1.11.eng: These four bases of psychic power should be developed for the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these five higher fetters.”

sn51.77-86:1.12.eng: (Tell in full as in the Linked Discourses on the Path at SN 45.171–180.)

sn51.77-86:2.4.eng: aggregates, and fetters high and low.

sn51.77-86:2.5.eng: The Linked Discourses on the Bases of Psychic Power is the seventh section.

sn51.8:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four bases of psychic power.

sn51.8:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.8:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.8:1.7.eng: These are the four bases of psychic power.

sn51.8:1.8.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā tathāgato ‘arahaṃ sammāsambuddho’ti vuccatī”ti.
sn51.8:1.8.eng: It is because he has developed and cultivated these four bases of psychic power that the Realized One is called ‘the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha’.”

sn51.9:1.1.pli: “‘Ayaṃ chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādo’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
sn51.9:1.1.eng: “Mendicants: ‘This is the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.

sn51.9:1.2.pli: ‘So kho panāyaṃ chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādo bhāvetabbo’ti me, bhikkhave …
sn51.9:1.2.eng: ‘This basis of psychic power … should be developed.’ …

sn51.9:1.3.pli: ‘bhāvito’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
sn51.9:1.3.eng: ‘This basis of psychic power … has been developed.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
